intro: Euphrasia durietzii, commonly known as the Durietz's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in alpine environments. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in several countries.
